name: Bits and Gits of EnCollab
tagline: All the information and docs that you will need to set up and run for the Encollab
body:
### Tools and Equipments
1. #### Processor :computer:
Preferably preferably (Core i5 3rd Generation or higher)

2. #### Screens :tv:
It is best to have a secondary screen to split your work in different view and also to check how your creation will look on different screen resolution. Especially if you are using a notebook to do the development work, the second monitor is strongly recommended. Alternatively, you can also check how the page will look on different screen via <http://quirktools.com/screenfly/>. 

3. #### Text Editors :memo:
If you have preferred choice of text editor, use it. Otherwise, [Sublime](http://code.tutsplus.com/articles/perfect-workflow-in-sublime-text-free-course--net-27293) is recommended.

### Communication :calling:
Team EnCollab uses the application called __#Slack__ to communicate among developers. Different channels are created to discuss different topics or projects that we are working on. __Skype__ is the preferred form of calling if you want to talk to another team member. Clear communication is imperative. Clear your doubt with your team members before you start working in order to not waste your time and effort.

#### Communication Tools
 * __#Slack__ can be access in __three__ ways
    1. Browser
    2. Desktop Apps
       * Mac
       * Windows
       * Linux
    3. Mobile Apps
       * iOS
       * Android
       * Windows Phone
 * __Good things about _#Slack_ is:__
  * when you are added to the Channel (i.e. Chat group), you can see the history of the conversation when the channel was first started. :+1:
  * When you enabled the push notification on your mobile device, it automatically disabled the e-mail notification. :+1:

### Source Codes Control (Git on GitHub) :floppy_disk:
Encollab uses Git for source codes version control. Therefore, one needs to be familiar with the git commands. If you have used any command-line interface like __Cygwin__, it is a similar kind. To get access to the EnCollab's repositories on GitHub, follow the steps below.

1. Open the account on <https://github.com/>
2. Acquire access to __Encollab__ Repositories from _**Graham R**_(@grahamrobbo).
3. For a start [Download](https://desktop.github.com/) the GitHub Desktop version for easier access.
4. The entire [__Pro Git Book__](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2) is available online if we need to check how git works.
5. To learn about some of the Git Terms, [link] (https://help.github.com/articles/github-glossary/#git)
6. To Download Git, [link] (https://git-scm.com/downloads)
7. To practice Git without reading, [link](https://try.github.io/levels/1/challenges/1)

# How to Set up the UI5 Development Environment

### Step 1: Java Installation

Download the latest version of JDK from this [link](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk8-downloads-2133151.html). After the download has finished, unzip the file into the directory where you want to install. Recommended location _**C:\Program Files\Java**_

After the JDK installation, set up the environment variable by following the steps below:

* open _command prompt_, type _"**control sysdm.cpl**"_

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/00.PNG)

* go to _Advanced_ tab, click _"**Environment Variables**"_

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/0.png)

* Click _"New"_ for _"User variables for Admin"_
* Variable name **"JAVA_HOME"**, Variable value _"Browse Directory"_ for the JDK installed location, and click OK.

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/2.png)
![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/3.png)

* Select _"Path"_ on _"System variables"_, click _"Edit"_

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/4.png)

* Click _"New"_ on _"Edit environment variable"_
* Enter _"%JAVA_HOME%"_, and click _"OK"_

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/6.png)

* open _command prompt_, type _"java -version"_

If JDK is installed correctly, the following screen should display

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/7.png)

### Step 2: Web Server Setup

Download the latest and stable version of Apache Tomcat from this [link](http://tomcat.apache.org/download-80.cgi). After the download has finished, unzip the file into the directory where you want to install. Recommended location _**C:\Program Files\**_ . After the installation, go to **bin** folder from command prompt and type _**"startup.bat"**_

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/15.png)

You will see the following windows

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/16.png)

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/17.png)

### Step 3: Eclipse Setup

Download the latest version of Eclipse IDE for Java EE developers from this [link](http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/packages/eclipse-ide-java-ee-developers/mars2-rc2). After the download has finished, unzip the file into the directory where you want to install. Recommended location _**C:\Program Files\**_ . After the installation, click on eclipse.exe and create desktop shortcut. When the eclipse start for the first time, you will have to choose the specific location for your workspace. All your eclipse projects will store in that workspace.

### Step 4: Add the web server to the Eclipse

Open Eclipse, go to "File > New > Others"

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/8.png)

Choose "Server", click "Next"

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/9.png)

Expand "Apache", choose the version of Tomcat that you installed.

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/10.png)

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/11.png)

After that click "Next", and "Finish"

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/12.png)

After that, go to "Window > Show View > Servers"

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/13.png)

You will see the new server has been added. Right click on the instance to start and stop the server.

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/27.PNG)

* if you receive the following error when starting the server.

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/26.png)

* you can either kill the process which is utilizing the port or change the port number of apache tomcat in the **server.xml** file located in the **conf** folder.

* to kill the process, go to command prompt, enter **"netstat -ano"**. Check the PID of the process which is using the desired port number. Then, enter **taskkill /PID xxxx**

### Step 5: SAPUI5 installation

Open Eclipse, got to **"Help > Install New Software"**

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/14.png)

Paste the following URL in the "Work with" field, and click "Add". You can get a list of updated URLs from the following [link](https://tools.hana.ondemand.com/#sapui5).

* https://tools.hana.ondemand.com/mars/


Select the **"UI Development Toolkit for HTML5"** and click _"Next"_.

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/22.png)

You will see the overview of the features to be installed, click _"Next"_.

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/23.png)

Confirm the license agreement and click "Finish"

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/24.png)

Once the installation is done, it will prompt to restart the Eclipse. Click **"Yes"**.

![](https://github.com/Encollab/startmeup/blob/master/files/pics/25.png)

## > Simple Hello World UI5 web application

* Open Eclipse, click **"File > New > Others"**. Choose **"SAPUI5 Application Development > Application Project"**

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/28.png)

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/29.png)

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/30.png)

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/31.png)

* Go to **"index.html"** and type _Hello World_ in the body tag

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/31_b.PNG)

* Save the project. Run As > Run on Server > Choose the Tomcat, you will see the following screen

![](https://github.com/Encollab/startmeup/blob/master/files/pics/33.PNG)

* You can also **Deploy on the Tomcat Server** by exporting the project as **.WAR**

* _Right click_ on the project name. From the context menu, choose **"Export > WAR file"**

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/34.png)

* Copy the WAR file to the **"webapps"** folder in the Apache tomcat directory

* Restart the apache by running **"startup.bat"** from the _command prompt_. You can access your web application under **"http://localhost:8080/app_name/index.html"**

![](https://github.com/thesususoe/thesususoe.github.io/blob/master/files/pics/32.PNG)

## > Read Me First
It is recommended to read the information on this [link](https://openui5.hana.ondemand.com/#docs/guide/167193ced54c41c3961d7df3479d7bbe.html) before starting to use OpenUI5.
